page.title: 01N Crathie & Balmoral Castle
page.content: The major part of this area lies to the north of the River Dee at Crathie. The morland road is single track and often blocked by snow during the winter. The few scattered farms run on traditional family lines with cattle, sheep and some crops. The area also includes the royal Family's Castle at balmoral. The ballroom contains exhibition material, and is open to the public in May, June and July every year. It is a very popular tourist attraction for Deeside. the royal Family stay at Balmoral for their annual holidays. Heather, Silver birch and Scots Pine forests give the area a distinctive natural beauty. Wildlife is abundant, with many small mammals, red and roe deer, fox, oter, moorland birds and birds of prey. Creag a Chlamhain- buzzard's Crag - rises directly above Crathie,
